question: is it correct to carry out JAMMAT for the prayer at the time when one JAMMAT has been carried out in a mosque or at any other place i mean in office etc
answer:
QUESTION

1) is it correct to carry out JAMMAT for the prayer at the time when one JAMMAT has been carried out in a mosque or at any other place i mean in office etc.

2) is there any need to do Wadhu again after one has taken ghusal ?

3) its difficult for me to get up for Fajr namaz. am taking medicines ,,,mite b its due to that .....wat shud i do to get up for fajr prayer at the rite time ....is there any dua for this ?

ANSWER


Share:

1. If the official congregation (Jamaat) in a Musjid (Mosque) had taken place, a second Jamaat may be conducted out of the Musjid proper. For example, in the Sahn area. A Jamaat may also be formed in the office or elsewhere.

2. Generally, in Ghusl, the limbs of Wudhu are also washed and one will also be regarded being in the state of Wudhu after Ghusl.

3. We answer only Fiqhi questions on this site.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
